result.execSummary:
The defendant Ishmael D Riley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ishmael D Riley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ishmael D Riley was found guilty of Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Ishmael D Riley was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Take all prescribed medications as prescribed. DNA on file.
Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days. Court authorized payment plan.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Ishmael D Riley in court, in custody.  Attorney Tracey Lencioni for Amy M Johnson in court for Ishmael D Riley.  Attorney Paul W. Humphrey in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea cts 1, 2. DISM cts 3, 4, 5. 2 years probation. Argument. No statement by DE. DNA on file. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1, 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #3, 4, 5   . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   1, 2
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years , cc to 21CM2323, 21CF2409, 22CF134

CONDITIONS:

-Not use/posses,s drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-DNA on file

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

-Restitution: No objection. Order signed. 

-Shall not be on any UW property
-Shall not possess any counterfeit money
-Take all prescribed medications as prescribed

Becky K
